sub_topic: Identifying the cut vertices and bridges in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

![Graph Image](https://i.imgur.com/BJBYvxK.png)

Identify the cut vertices and bridges in this graph.
message_2:
A cut vertex (also known as an articulation point) is a vertex whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph. A bridge is an edge whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph.

In the given graph, the cut vertices are:
- Vertex 1: Removing it disconnects vertices 2, 3, and 4 from the rest of the graph.
- Vertex 5: Removing it disconnects vertices 6, 7, and 8 from the rest of the graph.

The bridges in the graph are:
- Edge (1, 5): Removing it disconnects vertices 6, 7, and 8 from the rest of the graph.
- Edge (1, 9): Removing it disconnects vertex 9 from the rest of the graph.
